arm_group.arm_group_label: CBT- based SMS text messaging intervention
arm_group.description: cognitive behavioral therapy- (CBT-) based short message service (SMS) text messaging intervention
Placebo texts will be given instead of interventional texts

brief_summary.textblock:
This Phase I behavior therapy development study seeks to improve treatment outcomes for
      methamphetamine (MA)-dependent subjects by developing a novel cognitive behavioral therapy-
      (CBT-) based short message service (SMS) text messaging intervention.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Cognitive Behavioral Therapy-Based Text Message Intervention for Methamphetamine Dependence

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  English-speaking adults ≥ 18 years who are seeking treatment for MA addiction.

          -  Own a cellular phone with SMS text messaging capability and have an unlimited text
             messaging plan.

          -  Available to attend CBT therapy groups.

          -  Agreeable to conditions of the study and signed an informed consent form.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Projected to be unavailable > 12 hours/day to read and send text messages.

          -  Any medical or psychosocial condition that would preclude safe, useful, or consistent
             participation,

intervention.arm_group_label: CBT- based SMS text messaging intervention
intervention.intervention_name: CBT- based SMS text messaging intervention

arm_group_label: CBT- based SMS text messaging intervention

link.description: clinical site at which patients are seen

clinical_study.official_title: A Cognitive Behavioral Therapy-Based Text Message Intervention for Methamphetamine Dependence

primary_outcome.description: The primary efficacy measure for this study is the difference in proportion of MA-negative urine samples between the 2-week CBT text period and the 2-week control period. Urine samples will be analyzed for MA by immunoassay with a cutoff of 1,000 ng/mL.
primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of MA-negative urine samples between the 2-week CBT text period and the 2-week control period

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
